WRITING.TITLE: What should I expect from AP Biology?
WRITING.TEXT: Hey there. I #8217;m an incoming sophomore who #8217;s going to take AP Biology and... oddly enough, I #8217;m stoked. I heard the class is really hard but I enjoyed standard biology a lot this year. It #8217;s a field that I have genuine interest in, so I decided to take AP Biology to get possible college credits and to build my knowledge. On an extra note.. I #8217;m taking online classes. From anyone who #8217;s taken AP Bio, what should I expect? From anyone who #8217;s taken AP (especially AP science) classes in online school in general, how is it? What kind of expectations did you have? Thanks. Sorry if this is a redundant question by the way, thank you for reading!

WRITING.TITLE: In your personal opinion, what is the strongest and weakest post-IOI/Wanna One groups?
WRITING.TEXT: If you #8217;re familiar with I.O.I/Wanna One, you may be a follower of some of their original groups after Produce. Which of these groups has caught your eye the most, what do you consider the strongest? On the other hand, what group is on the weaker end for you, or isn #8217;t within your personal tastes? I #8217;m not a huge fan of Wanna One nor do I follow their post-Produce groups a lot but I am a fan of post IOI groups. In my opinion, WJSN has caught my eye the most. They are strong in vocals, rapping, dancing, visuals, and overall concept. They are silly and have decent variety skills. I love them snd they #8217;re one of my ults. On the other hand, I haven #8217;t had much interest in Weki Meki. Most of their singles have only scored a #8220;meh #8221; from me. Their concept confuses me and I feel like they don #8217;t have a niche yet. However, I don #8217;t think they #8217;re untalented.

WRITING.TITLE: Will we ever have subunit comebacks?
WRITING.TEXT: It seems like all of LOONA #8217;s subunits so far release an EP, a repackage, and dip, with the exception of YYXY. We were supposed to get the ballad album, which I #8217;m not sure if it was supposed to be for YYXY or OT12. In the near future, I #8217;d love to see subunit comebacks. Full group comebacks are great, of course, but a couple of scattered subunit comebacks throughout the year would be nice to see. I really want 1/3 to make a comeback, possibly with Yeojin.

WRITING.TEXT: Hey dudes. I #8217;m going to be a sophomore this September and I #8217;m looking forward to it. NTA - this stuff is pretty juvenile but I #8217;m also your age, experiencing the same high school drama, so what can I say. You don #8217;t have to talk to her if she treats you badly and with disdain. Don #8217;t associate with petty people who make you feel like shit, but don #8217;t take it too seriously, either.

ESH/leaning towards YTA: You are 18. Your brother is 10, he is a little kid, albeit a bratty kid, with a lot to learn. Now you #8217;ve cost your parents in damages, as they have to get a new phone for the kid, damaged your relationship with your brother, and escalated the situation overall. A better idea would #8217;ve been to get your parents involved or to turn off the modem/the internet so your brother doesn #8217;t have access to it overnight. Breaking his phone only made things worse.

I think racist/offensive jokes in general are usually in poor taste and I avoid making them. However I #8217;m used to my friends, and pretty much everyone else around me making them, considering I #8217;m in high school. If your friend was okay with it then NAH. Sounds like you two had a laugh over it. However, you sound immature, and you will be TA if you continue carelessly making racist jokes around people who ARE offended by it. If you aren #8217;t careful, this shit will land you with no friends. When making offensive jokes, all parties involved should be okay with it.

I listen to trashy, experimental, bubblegum pop so you can imagine the lyrics aren #8217;t always that great. I also listen to mainstream rap sometimes. Again, lyrics that aren #8217;t that great. I listen to K-Pop and I can #8217;t even understand the lyrics. So yeah, a song doesn #8217;t have to have top-tier, deep, edgy, reflective, etc. lyrics to be good. There #8217;s a lot more components to making a good song than just having relatable or #8220;deep #8221; lyrics.

WRITING.TITLE: Unpopular opinion: I don #8217;t think SuperM is a totally horrible idea.
WRITING.TEXT: I just wanted to say that I don #8217;t think SuperM, SM #8217;s new #8220;super group, #8221; is such a bad idea. WayV/NCT, EXO, and Taemin #8217;s solos are doing just fine. However, I think seeing a mashup of members of these groups together will be a breath of fresh air while SHINee and EXO members are enlisting. While it may have been a better idea to let the artists from the groups undergoing enlistment start their own solo pursuits, I think SM going to new heights isn #8217;t such a bad idea. WayV and NCT will get more promotion, and so will EXO and SHINee. If they are to have a US debut, I #8217;m sure it will catch the eyes of Americans and strengthen their original groups #8217; popularities in the states. I feel like some people are lying to themselves. Who wouldn #8217;t be excited to see all these members performing together on stage? With their stage presence and talent, it sounds amazing. However, I do think that it may be a bad idea in some way for NCT/WayV, as they are very actively promoting and this could take the members away from their original group. I #8217;m also concerned about NCT members especially being overworked. Though, perhaps it isn #8217;t all doom and gloom. This could be a really good idea. It #8217;s workable. How do you all feel about SM #8217;s new super group?
Oh god please no.

WRITING.TITLE: Forcing sexualities on idols as a #8216;joke #8217; is so annoying and gross.
WRITING.TEXT: if you #8217;ve ever spent a day on kpop stan twitter, you will notice that stans constantly push the narrative of being either gay, straight, bisexual, etc. on idols, especially when dating rumors come out. this is either done as a joke or done in genuine belief that a specific idol is [insert sexuality here]. it #8217;s honestly fucking gross. as a bisexual person, it makes me uncomfortable. treating kpop idols as if they #8217;re some sort of character where you can just make up sexualities, personalities, preferences, etc. is so fucking wrong. i #8217;ve seen fellow lgbt+ stans who do it say it #8217;s a way to #8220;cope, #8221; or just bypass it as a joke. even if it #8217;s a joke, it #8217;s rather dehumanizing to impose any type of sexuality on a real life person. it #8217;s gross, it #8217;s fetishizing, similarly with legitimately shipping idols with each other. just stop. and no, i #8217;m not a pissed off straight person who feels attacked by the #8220;queers #8221; or whatever, i just find it annoying and rather dehumanizing that certain stans like to force sexualities on idols, especially when dating rumors come out. i #8217;m sorry, but, if you #8217;re disappointed because your token kpop boy/girl isn #8217;t gay/lesbian/straight/etc. you have an issue.
didn #8217;t know this existed, thank you for commenting this lol
oh hell nah. scrapple is nasty.
i thought it was funny at first but now it #8217;s just gotten weird.. i don #8217;t understand this type of humor at all. it #8217;s funny the first couple times, thats it

yeah. i feel the same way. a lot of these are just jokes but it gets old really fast, and sometimes i wonder where #8217;s the line between immature joking and actual hatred/disdain. dunno. it #8217;s weird, i don #8217;t know why stans drag ACTUAL FUCKING PEOPLE into their jokingly hateful narrative

the people i #8217;ve talked to about this issue say it #8217;s a way for them to #8220;cope #8221; and #8220;relate #8221; to idols. like, what? you #8217;re just making their sexuality up and deciding it for them. if you want to find someone to relate to, stop ignoring actual lgbt+ idols/celebrities in other music industries, or make your own lgbt+ characters, or even read a kpop fanfic? it #8217;s ridiculous
it #8217;s so annoying, all of my mutuals on twitter do it and it #8217;s not funny, just makes you look annoying and immature

WRITING.TITLE: How can I follow authority better and have more motivation to do chores?
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m 15. I live with my parents and they really want me to do chores. They give me a couple of chores to do per day but I just, have absolutely no motivation to follow them, even with the incentive of money. For some reason, I have always been terribly lazy. I #8217;ve always had trouble following tasks and listening to authority. I can listen at a job, and I can listen to teachers, but I just have issues following tasks from my parents/other older people. I do great in school, but I lack heavily in household tasks. I really hate how lazy I am, I wish I had more motivation and I wish I was productive around the house. Please help? What can I do to make doing chores easier, how can I gain motivation, etc?
4chan? SMART? that #8217;s hilarious.

WRITING.TITLE: Does anyone else constantly repeat the same train of thought/what someone has said to you?
WRITING.TEXT: Lately, I #8217;ve been noticing that whenever I am worried about something, I constantly have #8220;thought loops, #8221; where the same train of thought will loop in my mind. This also happens with certain things people say to me. It #8217;s almost as if it #8217;s a method of reassuring myself that this is exactly what someone said to me. Additionally, this will also manifest into interactions I have with others. I constantly have to have other people repeat things, even if I can hear them clearly and understand them, just to reassure my mind. It #8217;s so weird, and I hate it. I often propose the same questions to myself and my thoughts will run in loops. When this happens, I often go silent and just get lost in my thoughts, making others around me put off by my behavior.
The fact that I google crazy shit related to my obsessions. I will google literally the most obscure and niche questions that pertain to my thoughts.
